page.title: 01Around Augher
page.content: The village of Augher lies about 60 miles south west of Belfast, and straddles the main road to Enniskillen. It has a population of around four hundred and fifty. The chief source of employment is the Aughen Creamery, where several varieties of cheese are produced. A feature of the village is a seventeenth century castle,which overlooks a picturesque lake. The surrounding area is entirely devoted to farming. Farms are small to medium ranging in size from ten to thity hectares. Apart from forage, few crops are grown, the emphasis being on milk and beef production. The land rises form the Blackwater which is a popular angling river. The terrain is hilly, with a maze of narrow twisting roads.
